Tolkien-related events that took place in 1936.

content.title: January
content.content: 14 - In his Preface to Roman Britain and the English Settlements, R.G. Collingwood on this date writes about J.R.R. Tolkien's contribution to the book.

content.title: March
content.content: 30 - C.A. Furth (of George Allen & Unwin Ltd) writes a letter to J.R.R. Tolkien.

content.title: April
content.content: 28 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes the manuscript "Primitive Quendian: Final Consonants".

content.title: May
content.content: 17 - Swedish author Lars Gustafsson, who were to conduct an interview with J.R.R. Tolkien, is born.

content.title: September
content.content:
4 - German translator Hans J. Sch√ºtz is born.
27 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Professor A. Pompen.

content.title: October
content.content:
3 - J.R.R. Tolkien finishes retyping The Hobbit.
10 - Stanley Unwin reads the typescript of The Hobbit.
17 - David Buck, who would voice Gimli in The Lord of the Rings (1978 film), is born.
21 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 8c.
30 - Rayner Unwin, aged 10, writes a "Report on the Hobbit".

content.title: November
content.content: 25 - J.R.R. Tolkien delivers the lecture "Beowulf: The Monsters and the Critics" to the British Academy.

content.title: December
content.content:
17 - Marian Diamond, who would voice Galadriel in The Lord of the Rings (1981 radio series), is born.
23 - Father Christmas writes a letter to J.R.R. Tolkien's children.

? - Allen and Unwin read the manuscript of The Hobbit and suggest that he complete it.
? - Songs for the Philologists is published.
? - Illustrator Peter Chuklev is born.
? - J.R.R. Tolkien's secretary Joy Hill is born.
